questions.text: Which driver of the number 17 car won the rain-shortened 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Matt Kenseth.

	Matt Kenseth, a driver from Wisconsin, was declared the winner of the 2009 Daytona 500 after rain caused NASCAR officials to halt the race in the 152nd of 200 scheduled laps. For Kenseth, it was his first career triumph at the Daytona track.

questions.text: Which driver of the number one car, qualified for the pole position at the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Martin Truex Jr.

	Martin Truex Jr., a native of New Jersey, won the pole position with a speed of 188 mph. He finished the race in 11th place.

questions.text: Which one of these veteran drivers qualified for the outside pole (front row) at the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Mark Martin.

	Mark Martin, appearing in his 25th Daytona 500, qualified in second place for the big race. He ended up in 16th place.

questions.text: Marcos Ambrose was one of two non-USA born drivers who started in the 2009 Daytona 500. In which country was he born?
questions.explanation:
Australia.

	Marcos Ambrose, from Tasmania, became the first Australian to drive in the Daytona 500. He started in 23rd place and wound up in the 17th position. Juan Pablo Montoya from Colombia, was the other international-born racer in the 500.

questions.text: Which driver of the number 29 car finished second in the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Harvick.

	Kevin "Happy" Harvick was the winner of the 2007 Daytona 500. His number 29 Chevrolet provided the push which propelled Matt Kenseth to victory in the 2009 Daytona 500. Sadler finished in fifth place and Burton ended up in 28th place. Marlin did not compete in the race.

questions.text: Which driver of the number 18 car held the lead at the halfway point (lap 100)?
questions.explanation:
Kyle Busch.

	Kyle Busch had a strong car throughout the early portion of the race.  He led a race-high 88 laps. However, Busch's car was collected in a multi-car crash, and he was forced to retire from the race.

questions.text: Which driver of the number 83 car tangled with Dale Earnhardt Jr, to cause a 10-car melee at approximately the 125 lap mark of the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Brian Vickers.

	Brian Vickers and Dale Earnhardt Jr. caused the biggest wreck of the race when they started bumping and banging on the lower portion of the track. Vickers spun out of control into a group of cars and caused serious damage to about 10 autos, including his own. After the race, Vickers and Junior blamed each other for the accident.

questions.text: In 2009, which one of these NASCAR team owners won his first Daytona 500 race?
questions.explanation:
Jack Roush.

	Jack Roush, the "Cat in the Hat", was thrilled to finally win his first Daytona 500 race after many years of trying. Matt Kenseth piloted the Roush number 17 Ford to victory lane.

questions.text: Which one of these star NASCAR drivers failed to finish in the top 10 of the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Gordon.

	Jeff Gordon, a three-time winner of the Daytona 500, was beset by tire problems and only managed a 13th place position. Waltrip ended up in seventh place, Stewart finished in eighth position, and Busch wound up in the 10 spot.

questions.text: Which 18-year old rookie driver started in the 2009 Daytona 500?
questions.explanation:
Joey Logano.

	Joey Logano, from Connecticut, drove the number 20 car in the 2009 Daytona 500. His race day ended early when he collided with fellow rookie driver Scott Speed; Logano finished in last (43rd) position.
